page.title: 12PUBLIC FACILITIES, TURTON
page.content: The services for the area are provided by two local authorities, Blackburn provides for the area in Lancashire, and Bolton for the area in Greater Manchester. These services include weekly refuse collections, sewage disposal, street and lighting maintainance and cleaning, and the upkeep of parks and public gardens. There are no library facilities in the village, but 35% regularly use nearby libraries. The local authorities provide for the education of the children, although the Church provides for the upkeep of Walmsley School. Children residing in Lancashire are educated in Bolton at secondary level, and residents in Lancashire rely on Bolton to provide other than basic facilities.
